intro: Zigadenus virescens, commonly known as the greenleaf deathwhisk, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces toxic alkaloids, making it highly poisonous to both animals and humans. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its striking appearance and dangerous properties make it a notable yet hazardous species in its native range.
